intro: Callichroa angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf callichroa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, giving it its common name. Callichroa angustifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
